channel.title: Nullpointerexeption
channel.description: alright.. i get these alot and have no idea how to fix.. me and my 2 other friends (they are pro coders) have been working on it.. but since they never had problems with it they cannot seem to find it either. Is there anybody that would know about fixing this?? I am almost to the point of leting someone take a crack at it... if they want... but this started before i even added customs to my client.. is there a problem with that?? or do ALL items need to be coded into the server as well??

item.title: Nullpointerexeption
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:7, topic:268045”][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=353819.msg2711576#msg2711576 date=1237335395]

yea… that helped me completely NONE!!![br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 17, 2009, 05:14:43 pm[/size][hr]yawn… i cant believe 2 people posted…and they were completely no help

I can’t help it if you’re in idiot. You figure it out.
[/quote]

sorry dude… im not an idiot… i have gotten TONS farther than about 50% of people who post here… at least i can code my own shit… only thing is i dont know what to change or where to change to fix nullpointerexpetions… and a 317 server file has about 50 files… thats too much for 1 problem… next time try being acually… hmm… whats the word… not a fucking jackass??[/quote]
I offered you help and you didn’t even thank me or ask me to explain what was meant by what I posted.
Try not being an ignorant cunt.

Read full topic

sorry dude… im not an idiot… i have gotten TONS farther than about 50% of people who post here… at least i can code my own shit… only thing is i dont know what to change or where to change to fix nullpointerexpetions… and a 317 server file has about 50 files… thats too much for 1 problem… next time try being acually… hmm… whats the word… not a fucking jackass??[/quote]

Maybe you should focus on organizing your classes, and xx qwertyuiop xx quoted how a nullPointerExeption is created. To destroy something you reverse the building process, so if a nullPointereeseption is created you must reverse the process in witch is what created thus destroying it.

item.title: Nullpointerexeption
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:2, topic:268045”]They can’t be that pro if they can’t figure out a NullPointerException.

[quote author=java.sun.com]
Thrown when an application attempts to use null in a case where an object is required. These include:

[ul][li]Calling the instance method of a null object.[/li]
[li]Accessing or modifying the field of a null object.[/li]
[li]Taking the length of null as if it were an array.[/li]
[li]Accessing or modifying the slots of null as if it were an array.[/li]
[li]Throwing null as if it were a Throwable value.[/li][/ul]

[/quote][/quote]

Read full topic
